ygData.subject: Re: Guild Training
ygData.msgSnippet: sorry what i meant to say was you can train at either guild, a cleric can train in a pally guild and vice versa, but i dont recall saying a cleric could train
ygData.messageBody:
sorry what i meant to say was you can train at either guild, a cleric can
train in a pally guild and vice versa, but i dont recall saying a cleric
could train at a pally trainer?? i said they are allys and are found in
same place or very close to each other


>From: "Jeff Portwine" <jdport@...>
>Reply-To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com
>To: <EQ-Clerics@onelist.com>
>Subject: Re: [EQ-Clerics] Guild Training
>Date: Mon, 22 Nov 1999 13:02:13 -0500
>
>That's not really true... they are allies, but you can't get training from
>a Paladin guildmaster. As somebody else said though, in Freeport the
>Paladin's and the Clerics guild are in the same temple... and unless they
>are carrying a weapon that identifies them as a cleric or a paladin, it's
>not easy to tell which is which. If you go to a paladin guildmaster, they
>will still say you are not a paladin and refuse to help you. However, the
>person standing next to them may be a cleric... so you can train from them.
>
>-Eachann Bronzeleaf,
>-Cleric of Tunare, Tarew Marr
>
>----- Original Message -----
>From: Anne O <topaaz1@...>
>To: <EQ-Clerics@onelist.com>
>Sent: Monday, November 22, 1999 12:20 PM
>Subject: Re: [EQ-Clerics] Guild Training
>
>
> > From: "Anne O" <topaaz1@...>
> >

>so
> > therefore you can tain at both guilds, that is why you usually allmost
> > always find the cleric and payy guild in same building or very close
> > togerher, i train at either, whichever i come to first =0)
> > topaaz====xegony

> > >Last time I leveled I went back to Freeport to train. Not knowing the
>area
> > >very well I managed to go to the Paladin's guild instead of the
>cleric's
> > >guild without realizing it (yes, I know, not very clever but it was
>very
> > >late). I located a trainer there and the system allowed her to train
>me.
> > >Just curious if any one else has done this and if this might allow a
>player
> > >to literally use any guild to train in. This has ,embarrassingly
>enough,
> > >worked twice for me.
